Package com.irurueta.server.commons.geolocation

Class IPGeolocator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.irurueta.server.commons.geolocation.IPGeolocator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    public class IPGeolocator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
    Class to locate an IP address.

      • getInstance

        public static IPGeolocator getInstance()

      • locate

        public IPLocation locate​(java.net.InetAddress address,
                         IPGeolocationLevel level)
                  throws IPGeolocationDisabledException,
                         IPLocationNotFoundException
        Locates provided IP or IPv6 address using requested level. Notice that geolocation levels are: Country, City (which includes country information) and Disabled, which throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        address - IP address to evaluate.
        level - level of accuracy of geolocation.
        Returns:
        location of IP address.
        Throws:
        IPGeolocationDisabledException - if IP geolocation is disabled or was not properly configured.
        IPLocationNotFoundException - if IP address couldn't be geolocated because it wasn't found in database.

      • locate

        public IPLocation locate​(java.lang.String address,
                         IPGeolocationLevel level)
                  throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                         IPGeolocationDisabledException,
                         IPLocationNotFoundException
        Locates provided IP or IPv6 address using requested level. Notice that geolocation levels are: Country, City (which includes country information) and Organization (which includes both City and Country information)
        Parameters:
        address - IP address or DNS host name to evaluate in string form.
        level - level of accuracy of geolocation.
        Returns:
        location of IP address.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if provided textual form of IP address is not valid, or if DNS host name couldn't be resolved into an IP address.
        IPGeolocationDisabledException - if IP geolocation is disabled or was not properly configured.
        IPLocationNotFoundException - if IP address couldn't be geolocated because it wasn't found in database.

      • locate

        public IPLocation locate​(java.net.InetAddress address)
                  throws IPGeolocationDisabledException,
                         IPLocationNotFoundException
        Locates provided IP or IPv6 address using default configured geolocation level of accuracy.
        Parameters:
        address - IP address to evaluate.
        Returns:
        location of IP address.
        Throws:
        IPGeolocationDisabledException - if IP geolocation is disabled or was not properly configured.
        IPLocationNotFoundException - if IP address couldn't be geolocated because it wasn't found in database.

      • locate

        public IPLocation locate​(java.lang.String address)
                  throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                         IPGeolocationDisabledException,
                         IPLocationNotFoundException
        Locates provided IP or IPv6 address using default configured geolocation level of accuracy.
        Parameters:
        address - IP address or DNS host name to evaluate in string form
        Returns:
        location of IP address.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if provided textual form of IP address is not valid, or if DNS host name couldn't be resolved into an IP address.
        IPGeolocationDisabledException - if IP geolocation is disabled or was not properly configured.
        IPLocationNotFoundException - if IP address couldn't be geolocated because it wasn't found in database.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes location services. Once closed, geolocation will not be available. If databases where embedded, then their destination local files will also be deleted when closing location services. This method should be called at server shutdown or when application is un-deployed.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • reset

        protected static void reset()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Closes geolocation services if a configured IPGeolocator exists, and resets the current singleton instance so a new one can be acquired having a new configuration if required.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • prepareCityDatabase

        private boolean prepareCityDatabase()
                             throws java.io.IOException

        Returns:
        true if database was prepared, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • copyResource

        private void copyResource​(java.lang.String resource,
                          java.lang.String file)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Copies a given resource embedded in code into provided destination file. If file where data is to be stored does not exist, a new one will be created. If it already exists, it will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        resource - resource to read data from.
        file - file to store data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - .
